channel.title: Icons on panel and window bar just show “a qube” instead of its application’s icon. (kicksecure)
channel.description:
Hi everyone. This article comes from QubesOS forum: `https://forum.qubes-os.org/t/icons-on-panel-just-show-a-qube-instead-of-its-applications-icon-minimal-template/11416` (Sorry new for the forum, cannot include link on post.)
To conclude, I've followed the guide from kicksecure's wiki, morphing debian-minimal template to kicksecure, and install lkrg, tirdad dkms modules, and enabling hardened-malloc.
I found that after enabling/installing hardened-malloc(both of default and light), the issue comes out as title says.
The whonix-gw template and its appvm also have the same situation so I am here to ask for help.

item.title: Icons on panel and window bar just show “a qube” instead of its application’s icon. (kicksecure)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
whoareyou1:

I’ve followed the guide from kicksecure’s wiki, morphing debian-minimal template to kicksecure

This is the wrong forum. The correct forum is →

Kicksecure Forums

Kicksecure Forums

Secure by Default Operating System

Also replied here:

Qubes OS Forum – 23 Oct 22

Icons on panel just show "a qube" instead of its application's icon. (minimal...

Kicksecure specific questions should go to: Full disclosure: I am a developer of Kicksecure. Isn’t a Kicksecure issue either. The issue is happening with Qubes + Hardened Malloc.

Read full topic
item.source: Icons on panel and window bar just show “a qube” instead of its application’s icon. (kicksecure)

item.title: Icons on panel and window bar just show “a qube” instead of its application’s icon. (kicksecure)
item.dc:creator: whoareyou1
item.description:
Hi everyone.
This article comes from QubesOS forum:
https://forum.qubes-os.org/t/icons-on-panel-just-show-a-qube-instead-of-its-applications-icon-minimal-template/11416
(Sorry new for the forum, cannot include link on post.)

To conclude, I’ve followed the guide from kicksecure’s wiki, morphing debian-minimal template to kicksecure, and install lkrg, tirdad dkms modules, and enabling hardened-malloc.

I found that after enabling/installing hardened-malloc(both of default and light), the issue comes out as title says.

The whonix-gw template and its appvm also have the same situation so I am here to ask for help.

Read full topic
